pages.text: I'm not quite sure what happened... but all I know is that I'm here now; the open world in front of me. Sights, sounds, smells... it's almost overwhelming. But I need to gather myself.$(br2)I have a few things in my hands: a scroll of paper tied with a green ribbon, and some bread. The scroll... I'm not quite sure what it does, but I sense it's no ordinary

piece of paper. I better hang onto this; it may be useful later. The bread... good for a snack if I'm hungry later.$(br2)$(italics)$(#a84b0f)The Scroll of New Life can be used to set your spawnpoint, in lieu of a bed. It is a one-time use item, so be wise with where you choose to anchor yourself.$(br2)It can be overridden later on with other spawn setters like a bed.$()

Something tells me that nightfall won't be very pleasant; I can't quite place my finger on it, though.$(br2)I should take note of my surroundings and begin to gather materials, to anticipate whatever may come when the sun sets. A shelter and some basic tools are in line.$(br2)I feel as though I have some time to prepare, though that shouldn't make me complacent.

I might want to be careful about getting wounded... mobs might be attracted to the smell of my blood. They also seem to be attracted to loud sounds, so I should also block off noise-making blocks and creatures.
$(br2) $(br2) $(br2)$(italics)$(#a84b0f)The day/night cycle in RotN is 40 minutes in real-time; 20 minutes of night and day, twice as long as vanilla Minecraft.$()
